content: So I think we said something about @Aaron Turon or @acfoltzer having some idea of who might pursue this work?
Correct! My team is interested in implementing this, most likely point of contact will be Katie Martin.
Just to check: is there any particular timeline pressure here?
As far as I know, the only party expressing any timeline pressure throughout this process has been Fastly! So no, I don't think so.

:wave: Hello, I'm Katie! It is a pleasure to meet you all, I'm very excited to work on this. My deepest thanks to Niko, for the wonderfully detailed mentoring instructions provided in the tracking issue.
Hi Katie! Welcome, and thanks for working on this!
@katelyn martin no problem, I figured that'd be enough to get you started digging at least
@katelyn martin btw here are instructions for configuring rust-analyzer / rustc, in case you use vscode
very helpful when learning, since you can jump-to-def etc
